body.name: The First Created
body.body: The Kanae, or Dekatrian humans, were the first formed from the Book of Creation. As the resourceful, determined, adaptable people they were on Toril, Kavara the Creator kept the form of the humans mostly the same, with greater versatility in applying their skills. With this, humans among the lands of Dekatreis are still the most populous race.

body.name: Same Forms, New Additions
body.body: While the Kanae themselves were kept mostly same as their human counterparts on Toril, many of the Demigods began to wonder what they could do to create their own representations of races. They began to pitch ideas to Kavara, who experimented with the Book of Creation until she formed two new subraces of human: The Petona, and the Magia. She attached wings to the Petona and bolstered their body, while on the other side, she imbued the Magia with magic and invigorated them with a desire for knowledge and to have expertise in social attributes. With the eventual success of these new breeds of humans, the two subraces prospered and integrated within the world rather quickly, much like their original renditions.

body.name: A Demigod's Children
body.body: Finally, after the success of their initial developments of the human race, they decided to dabble into one more area of modification for the human race. While many of the Demigods were not human, they had learned quickly that they could not breed with each other nor their creations. Any children of the Demigods had to be made through the Book of Creation. As this realisation dawned on them, they decided to turn to Kavara and ask for her assistence, to give the Demigods children. Using two parents as a basis for this new race, Kavara melded their forms together, and after enough experimentation she arrived at what is now known as the "Kathari," a race of humans with the innate magic of the Magia, the innate wings of the Petona, and the bolstered bloodline of the Demigods. The Queen of Dekatreis herself was one such born of this practice, and many more alongside her

body.name: A New Name
body.body: While the Demigods did try to classify their children close to how they were on Toril, the name "Kanae" actually came much later to differenciate the Dekatrian humans from their Toril counterparts. While each subrace had their own names, those without innate wings or magic were simply "humans," until the name Kanae began to surface in Sarille under a law that established Kathari born outside of royalty would have their wings cut and their magic stifled, forcing them to appear and function the same as Kanae. This law, though very controversial, caused the name Kanae to become commonplace as reference to the Dekatrian humans without wings or innate magic.

body.name: Using Human Subraces
body.body: These are variations to the human race that exist in Dekatreis. You may choose these in addition to the variant human listed in the PHB and the normal human race in the PHB. All of the abilities listed here replace the "Ability Score Increase" trait that humans get by default.

body.name: Background
body.body: While they might seem like humans, that quickly changes as their beautiful wings spread out from behind them. Large and feathered, with hints of magical energy around them, these wings allow them to fly high in the sky like a majestic angel or bird might.

body.name: Ability Score Increases
body.body: Your Dexterity or Strength score increses by 2, and your Constitution increases by 1.

body.name: Flight
body.body: The Petona are graced with the power of wings, allowing them to fly high into the sky. You gain a flight speed of 25 feet and can hover while not wearing heavy armour or armour that you are not proficient in. Additionally, you cannot carry another creature that is a bigger size than Small while you are flying.

body.name: Background
body.body: Much like the Petona, you might think that they are normal humans, but unlike Petona they do not seem to have any outwards distinction. However, their abilities are inwards, granting them the natural affinity to use magic.

body.name: Ability Score Increase
body.body: Your Intelligence or Charisma score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

body.name: Magical Affinity
body.body: Due to magic in their blood, Magia gain an easily accessed supply to magic. You gain the properties of the Magic Initiate feat. You cannot gain the propreties of Magic Initiate again if you take this feat later.

body.name: Restricted
body.body: A Kathari has the bloodline of one of the 13 Demigods. Much like the Queen and the twinned princesses of Dekatreis, a Kathari's innate magic and wings grants them intense worship among the common people, even those who hold no official noble titles. In order to use the Kathari player race, you must ask your Dungeon Master for approval first.

body.name: Background
body.body: Kathari are a breed of humans that are distinct from the other variants of humans, coming from the bloodline of one of the original 13 Demigods. They take the best traits of the Petona and the Magia, and their divine blood boosts their usage of both of these powers.

body.name: Age
body.body: The Kathari, with their divine, empowered blood running through their heart, live a signifigantly longer lifespan than a normal Kanae. While they age at the same rate as the Kanae to start, they appear to age signifigantly slower past age 30. One of the oldest known Kathari, The Queen herself, has lived for a millennium, and many other Kathari reach the same age.

body.name: Ability Score Increase
body.body: Your Charisma or Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity or Strength score increases by 1.

body.name: Enhanced Flight
body.body: Superior to the Petona, Kathari are born with stronger wings than the other human variant. You gain a flight speed of 35 feet and can hover while not wearing heavy armour or armour that you are not proficient in. Additionally, you cannot carry another creature that is a bigger size than Small while you are flying.

body.name: Enhanced Magical Affinity
body.body: Surpassing the Magia in their inate magical blood, Kathari can tap into a much stronger well than their lesser variant can. You gain the propreties of the Magic Initiate feat, but you may pick an additional cantrip and 1st-level spell in addition to the cantrips and spell you already gain. You cannot gain the propreties of Magic Initiate again if you take this feat later.

body.name: Background
body.body: Unlike the Petona, Magia, and Kathari, the Nekomimi weren't an experiment but a recreation of the cat-like races from the old world. With sensitive, cat-like ears and tails to enhance their balance, they quickly became the hunting masters of the human race.

body.name: Darkvision
body.body: Your ancestors were remarkable hunters and had the feline grace of the greatest big cats. Adapting their traits, Nekomimi have cat-like eyes and various other features from their ancestors, which can include furred tails, ears, and sometimes claws. You can see perfectly in dim light out to 60 feet, and can see in complete darkness as if it was dim light.

body.name: Cat Fall
body.body: Whenever you would suffer fall damage, you may use your reaction to reduce the incoming damage by 5 times your level. If this would reduce the damage to 0, you do not fall prone and instead land on your feet. If you gain Slow Fall from any class ability, this adds to Slow Fall's damage reduction additively and you may use both as one reaction.
